pr_title: Created type doesn't implement sealed interface.

timeline.bodyText: I'd say the default would be final. Since the user is trying to restrict implementations, it'd make more sense to leave those restricted as well by default
timeline.author: fbricon

replies.bodyText: I don't remember if we're allowed to return snippets at that point, but if yes, and provided the client supports snippets, then returning ${1:|final,non-sealed,sealed|} would be the best.
replies.author: fbricon

replies.bodyText:
Cool feature. It would seem to be a great replacement for what JDT UI calls "linked proposals". There are proposals that allow cycling through a set of fixed values at various points of an applied code snippet/template.
From what I can tell, only CompletionItem supports snippets through the CompletionItem#setInsertTextFormat(InsertTextFormat.Snippet), assuming the client supports it. However, quick fixes/assists are represented as CodeAction, and I don't see a way of indicating the TextEdit(s) may contain snippets for resolution.
For now I've set it to final.
replies.author: rgrunber

timeline.bodyText:
We already know parent and type are not null, since they're an instance of Type.
I think you want to check if typeDecl != null at some point
timeline.author: fbricon

replies.bodyText: Done. Moved typeDecl non-null check prior to calling typeDecl.isInterface().
replies.author: rgrunber

timeline.author: fbricon

timeline.bodyText: on L 395, please change StringBuilder buf = new StringBuilder();
timeline.author: fbricon

timeline.message:

- Fixes #1553
- Add testcase

timeline.bodyText: we could avoid calling fCompilationUnit.findPrimaryType() several times in the same method, since a bunch of processing is happening behind the scene every time.
timeline.author: fbricon

timeline.bodyText: Assign fCompilationUnit.findPrimaryType() to a variable and reuse it on L413 and L434

timeline.bodyText: Note : Attempting to upstream this as https://git.eclipse.org/r/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.ui/+/170568 .
timeline.author: rgrunber

replies.bodyText: When M2 is released, this block may be deleted ( https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=567770 )
replies.author: rgrunber

timeline.bodyText: if E declares methods, then class F implements E but not those methods, leading to a compilation error
timeline.author: fbricon

replies.bodyText:
I'll have another look at this. The initial problem I had was that adding the "add unimplemented methods" quick fix to the end of the existing one would fail because the ASTRewrite complained if the underlying CU didn't yet exist (which is the case here for F). This is why a lot of the code uses literal values to generate the code (eg. StubUtility* helpers). I could try calling StubUtility2Core.createImplementationStubCore(..) directly once we get the unimplemented methods but even that seems to require an ASTRewrite.
When E declares methods, and after the create type is applied, there should be a separate quick fix to add those unimplemented methods.
replies.author: rgrunber

replies.bodyText: So given this is a more global issue with generated types, we'll address this in a separate issue.
replies.author: fbricon
